channel.title: Help with this :]
channel.description:
ok so i have a command that adds global objects but if u tele away and come back its not there n e more so if u leave the area they disappear when u come back i was wondering if its possible to make it so every 10 seconds it repeats the command if i turn on another command possible? if so how :] also how do i make it so when sum1 teles sumwhere it kicks them but when they log back in it has them where they teled :]
these are all for my clanwars i am coding :P

item.title: Help with this :]
item.dc:creator: @Lexii Lexii
item.description:
@Lexii wrote:

Ixl Adds Ixl:

spawning commands are a temporary command, they don’t stay there forever while server is online. They will go away when you leave out of its sight (perspectively from personal view though), also when you reestablish your server as well.

well…if i made them actually there instead of a command spawning them
and then i made a command to make then dissapear…would they stay away until the server was rebooted?
or would they still do the same thing
cuz what i really wanna do is have a command that makes them disappear
and then they reappear after a set time

EDIT
thank u super_!
u actual helped me instead of yelling…
well u yelled 2…
but u helped :]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this :]
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

okay, now seriously…

[code]import java.util.TimerTask;

public class GlobalObjectReloaderTask implements TimerTask {

public void run() {
    for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
        client c = (client) p;
        c.reloadGlobalObjects();
    }
}

public void cancel() {
    // empty implementation
}

}[/code]

import java.util.Timer;

Timer timer = new Timer("TIMER_THREAD"); timer.schedule(new GlobalObjectReloaderTask(), new Date(), 500);

public void reloadGlobalObjects() { //... add your object spawning here }
